title: Brian Redban
summary: Joe Rogan and co-host Brian Redban introduce the show in an unscripted, wide-ranging chat with offbeat humor.
utterances: Early days, laughing at technical difficulties.
Brian's wild stories kick things off.
transcript: Joe and Brian riff on life, podcast plans, and odd news. Format-free and relaxed.

title: Ari Shaffir
summary: Standup comic Ari Shaffir joins Joe for irreverent conversation on comedy gigs, drugs, and creative inspiration.
utterances: Mushroom stories: both hilarious and weird.
Standup is the backbone of the show.
transcript: Raw, spontaneous banter—plus tales from open mics and touring.

title: Duncan Trussell
summary: Joe and Duncan Trussell riff on psychedelics, spirituality, and absurd life moments—the start of recurring improv bits.
utterances: Trussell brings weird energy to every episode.
Joe’s philosophy tangents meet surreal improv.
Comedy flows with big laughs and digressions.
transcript: Psychedelic experiences mix with comic storytelling and philosophical speculation.

title: Tom Segura
summary: Joe is joined by Tom Segura to talk good and bad gigs, the art of crowd work, and behind-the-scenes standup.
utterances: Segura trades road stories and show mishaps.
Podcast gains momentum with running gags.
transcript: Tom and Joe swap club stories, dissecting what works and bombing on stage.

title: Joey Diaz
summary: Joe hosts Joey ‘Coco’ Diaz in a wild episode filled with outrageous life stories and raw, no-filter humor.
utterances: Diaz’s rants are a highlight of the podcast.
Unfiltered street tales meet philosophical riffing.
transcript: Joey opens up about bad gigs, jail time, and decades in the comedy trenches.

title: Bill Burr
summary: Comedian Bill Burr and Joe riff about anger in comedy, the politics of offense, and awkward gigs across America.
utterances: Burr’s rants are infamous for a reason.
Joe and Bill trade road jokes and critique club culture.
transcript: A classic pairing: sharp comedic insights and unscripted rants that would become a recurring podcast theme.

title: Tom Papa
summary: Tom and Joe talk about family, food obsessions, and how podcasts give comics a new life.
utterances: Papa’s food jokes break up the tension.
Does podcasting fix the standup grind?
Plenty of classic dad jokes and therapy talk.
transcript: Lots of laughter at parenting stories, podcasting philosophy, and the live comedy grind.

title: Marc Maron
summary: WTF podcaster Marc Maron reflects with Joe on addiction, career burnout, and the therapy found in microphones.
utterances: Podcasting as therapy is a recurring theme.
transcript: Confessional tone as they swap backstage stories and the mental health side of comedy.

title: Whitney Cummings
summary: Whitney and Joe joke about relationships, sexism in clubs, and the weirdness of TV writing.
utterances: Gender angle: sexism in green rooms gets laughs.
Unfiltered banter on fame and dating.
TV show myths and sitcom truths.
transcript: Sharp, unapologetic humor cuts through industry myths and real challenges for female comics.

title: Doug Stanhope
summary: No-holds-barred episode with Doug Stanhope on free speech, hecklers, and the dark comedy that earns cult fans.
utterances: Stanhope brings gallows humor to every topic.
Heckler stories and chaos on stage.
transcript: Total freedom of speech, taboo topics, and the difference between shock and wit.

title: Greg Fitzsimmons
summary: Greg and Joe cover the highs and lows of club comedy, opening acts, and dealing with creative egos.
transcript: Inside baseball for comics—full of stories, strategies, and classic showbiz advice.

title: Bert Kreischer
summary: From wild stories to heart, Kreischer's first episode is all party, with unexpected sincerity on family life.
transcript: Bert mixes debauchery, parenting, and philosophy in a trademark comedy blend.

title: Ron White
summary: The Texas comedy legend brings adult jokes, whisky, and sharp wit for a colorful discussion.
utterances: Breaking down fame, clubs, and touring.
Ron’s stories anchor every comic’s fantasy.
transcript: Camaraderie and southern storytelling turn raw road-warrior tales into gold.

title: Iliza Shlesinger
summary: Multifaceted comic Iliza sparrs with Joe about improv, writing, and surviving and thriving in comedy.
utterances: Iliza blends sharp insights and sharp jokes.
transcript: Fresh takes on young comics, women’s voice in comedy, and building a following from scratch.

title: Kevin Smith
summary: Director Kevin Smith and Joe share nerd-fandom, podcast stories, and behind-the-scenes movie talk.
utterances: Filmmaking insights crash into dirty jokes.
Smith’s lessons on podcasting and movies.
transcript: Pop culture and comic book lore meet with pure improv and Smith’s infectious positivity.

title: Ali Wong
summary: Ali and Joe tackle gender, raunch comedy, and immigrant family stories with speed and edge.
transcript: Mix of rapid-fire jokes and honest reflections on representation and success.

title: Russell Peters
summary: Peters brings international twists to comedy: accents, cultures, and why laughter crosses borders.
transcript: Laughs and lessons: how global comedy builds bridges in a multicultural world.

title: Sarah Silverman
summary: Joe interviews Silverman on pushing comedic boundaries, audience reactions, and political comedy.
transcript: Frank discussion of crossing boundaries, identity, and surviving bombed performances.

title: John Mulaney
summary: John and Joe get meta about joke writing, sitcom writers' rooms, and why John hates easy applause lines.
transcript: In-depth writing craft talk with more laughs per minute than a sitcom.

title: Patton Oswalt
summary: Patton Oswalt goes deep with Joe on comedy evolution, nerd culture, and dealing with tragic news.
utterances: Oswalt’s fans: some of the most loyal.
transcript: Honest and emotional, with jokes and lessons on artistic survival.
